title: Understanding Analysis Types
text: In analytical chemistry, different types of analyses are used to identify, quantify, and characterize substances. Consider what each type of analysis focuses on.

title: Qualitative vs Quantitative Analysis
text: Qualitative analysis is used to identify the components of a mixture, while quantitative analysis measures the amount of each component present.

title: Characterization Analysis
text: Characterization analysis provides information about the physical and chemical properties of a substance, but not necessarily its identity.

title: Choosing the Right Analysis
text: Given that the task is to identify the components of a complex mixture, which type of analysis would be most appropriate?
